summary: The IRS reported spending about $2.8 billion in FY 2020 on its IT systems for collecting taxes, distributing refunds, and more. According to the IRS, the five IT systems in our review met most of the performance goals it had set for FYs 2019 and 2020. But one of the systems, intended as a replacement for a 60-year-old system, is now on track to replace...
title: Information Technology: Cost and Schedule Performance of Selected IRS Investments
